title: Associate UCMDB SuperAdmin role (AKS)
content:
When the system provisions a UCMDB customer, the UD/UCMDB out-of-the-box (OOTB) roles with built-in permissions are automatically seeded in IdM. The application field of these seeded UD/UCMDB roles is "CMDB" (as shown in the following screenshot).

For details of the UD/UCMDB OOTB roles, see UD/UCMDB out-of-the-box roles.

The suite admin can do UD/UCMDB pre-authorization in IdM by associating these UD/UCMDB OOTB roles to corresponding IdM groups so that the suite admin doesn't need to grant permissions to the roles in UD/UCMDB manually but mapping to the built-in permissions. Take the shared IdM solution as an example, you can use the seeded UD/UCMDB OOTB SuperAdmin role directly without the need of creating a new UD/UCMDB Super Admin role in IdM manually.

Associate group

  1. Log in to the suite IdM (https://<External_Access_Host>/idm-admin) as suite-admin, and then access the SYSBO organization.

  2. Go to Groups in the navigation pane, click the administrators group, and then click   in the toolbar. The Group Settings page opens.

  3. In the Group Settings section, go to the Associated Roles field, search for and click the OOTB role SuperAdmin with the CMDB application field, and then associate it to the group.

  4. Click SAVE.

After you associate the OOTB role SuperAdmin with the CMDB application field to the administrators group, the users under this group are pre-authorized with UD/UCMDB super admin permissions. To perform administrative tasks in UCMDB, you can use suite-admin as the UCMDB Provider customer super admin (with the Server Administrator Privileges flag set and granted SuperAdmin role). The suite-admin can also log in to the JMX console with full access and perform global JMX operations, such as creating customers and deleting customers. 

After group association takes effect (at most two minutes), you can access UD/UCMDB with the suite-admin account. Replace <EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST> and <PORT> with the values that you specify for the global.externalAccessHost and global.externalAccessPort parameters in my-values.yaml.

User interface

Login URL

UCMDB Web UI

https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>:<PORT>/ucmdb-browser

UCMDB JMX Console

https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>:<PORT>/jmx-console

UCMDB Server Status

https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>:<PORT>/status

UCMDB Landing Page

https://<EXTERNAL_ACCESS_HOST>:<PORT>/cms

Next step

After you install the containerized UD/UCMDB, you can continue with the Associate Service Management tenants with UCMDB customers for Single Sign-On task and other subsequent tasks to enable Native SACM.
